meanings.meaning_en_US: To survive a difficult situation.

examples.sentence: They managed to [ride out] the storm.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們成功熬過了暴風雨。

examples.sentence: She will [ride out] the difficult times with her friends.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她將和朋友一起熬過困難時期。

examples.sentence: It’s important to [ride out] the tough phases of life.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 熬過生命中的艱難階段是重要的。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To launch or introduce a new product or service.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 推出或引入新產品或服務

examples.sentence: The company will [roll out] the new app next month.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 該公司將於下個月推出新應用程式。

examples.sentence: They are planning to [roll out] a marketing campaign.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們計劃推出一項行銷活動。

examples.sentence: The restaurant [rolled out] a new menu last week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 餐廳上週推出了新菜單。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To eliminate or exclude something from consideration.

examples.sentence: We need to [rule out] any possibilities of error.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們需要排除任何錯誤的可能性。

examples.sentence: After the discussion, they [ruled out] the first option.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 討論後，他們排除了第一個選項。

examples.sentence: The expert [ruled out] the theory as unlikely.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 專家認為該理論不太可能。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To escape from a place or situation.

examples.sentence: He decided to [run away] from home.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他決定逃離家裡。

examples.sentence: The child [ran away] after seeing the angry dog.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 那個孩子在看到生氣的狗後逃跑了。

examples.sentence: Sometimes, you just want to [run away] from your problems.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 有時候，你只想逃避你的問題。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To criticize someone or something; to exhaust a resource or to lose power.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 批評某人或某事；耗盡資源或失去力量

examples.sentence: She tends to [run down] others when she's upset.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在生氣時傾向於批評他人。

examples.sentence: The car [ran down] because we forgot to charge it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這輛車因為我們忘了充電而沒電了。

examples.sentence: He was [run down] after weeks of hard work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 經過幾週的努力工作後，他感到精疲力竭。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To meet someone unexpectedly.

examples.sentence: I [ran into] an old friend at the store.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我在商店意外地遇見了一位老朋友。

examples.sentence: We [ran into] each other while walking our dogs.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們在遛狗時意外碰面。

examples.sentence: She [ran into] trouble when she ignored the warning signs.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她忽視警告信號時遇到了麻煩。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To hit someone or something with a vehicle.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 用車輛撞到某人或某物

examples.sentence: He didn't see the cat and [ran over] it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他沒有看到貓，結果撞到了它。

examples.sentence: She was [run over] by a truck when crossing the street.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她在過馬路時被卡車撞到了。

examples.sentence: Make sure to avoid [running over] any obstacles on the road.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 確保避免撞到路上的任何障礙物。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To leave or exit in a hurry.

examples.sentence: She [rushed out] of the house to catch the bus.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她急匆匆地跑出家去趕公車。

examples.sentence: He [rushed out] when he realized he was late.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當他意識到自己遲到了，便急著出去。

examples.sentence: Don't [rush out] without your coat!
examples.translation_zh_TW: 別忘了帶上外套就匆忙出門！

meanings.meaning_en_US: To increase the size, amount, or extent of something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 增加某事的大小、數量或範圍

examples.sentence: The company plans to [scale up] production next year.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 公司計劃明年增加生產。

examples.sentence: They are trying to [scale up] their marketing efforts.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們正在嘗試擴大市場推廣的力度。

examples.sentence: In response to demand, we need to [scale up] operations.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為應對需求，我們需要擴大運營規模。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To make a mistake or mess something up.

examples.sentence: I really [screwed up] the presentation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我真的搞砸了演示文稿。

examples.sentence: He [screwed up] the recipe by forgetting an ingredient.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他因為忘了放一種配料而搞砸了食譜。

examples.sentence: Don't worry if you [screw up]; we can fix it.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你搞砸了，不要擔心；我們可以修正它。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To sell something quickly, often at a lower price.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 迅速出售某物，通常價格偏低

examples.sentence: The company decided to [sell off] its assets.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 公司決定快速出售其資產。

examples.sentence: They [sold off] their old inventory at a discount.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們以折扣售出了舊庫存。

examples.sentence: He had to [sell off] his collection due to financial issues.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他因為財務問題不得不出售他的收藏。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To completely sell all of something.

examples.sentence: The concert tickets [sold out] within hours.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 音樂會的票在幾小時內就售罄了。

examples.sentence: She [sold out] her entire inventory last week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 上週她的整個庫存都售罄了。

examples.sentence: We expect to [sell out] by the end of the season.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們預計本季末將會售罄。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To request someone to come.

examples.sentence: Please [send for] a doctor immediately.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請立即叫醫生來。

examples.sentence: I will [send for] help if things get worse.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果情況惡化，我就會請人來幫忙。

examples.sentence: She [sent for] her friend to discuss the matter.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她叫朋友過來討論這件事。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To go to the place where someone is leaving to say goodbye.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 到某人離開的地方去告別

examples.sentence: She went to the airport to [send off] her brother.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她去機場送別她的兄弟。

examples.sentence: We gathered to [send off] the departing volunteers.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們聚集在一起為即將離去的志愿者送行。

examples.sentence: He plans to [send off] a package tomorrow.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他打算明天寄出一個包裹。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To distribute or emit something.

examples.sentence: They will [send out] invitations next week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們下週將發出邀請函。

examples.sentence: The organization [sends out] newsletters every month.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 該組織每個月發送通訊。

examples.sentence: Please [send out] the information as soon as possible.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請儘快發送信息。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To delay or hinder progress.

examples.sentence: The heavy rain [set back] the construction schedule.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 大雨推遲了施工進度。

examples.sentence: Illness [set him back] for a few weeks.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 生病讓他耽擱了幾個星期。

examples.sentence: Budget cuts have [set back] the project timeline.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 預算削減已經推遲了項目時間表。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To place or establish something in a specific position.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 將某物放置或確定在特定位置

examples.sentence: Please [set down] your bags here.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請把你的包放在這裡。

examples.sentence: He [set down] the rules for the project clearly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他明確地規定了這個項目的規則。

examples.sentence: Make sure to [set down] your ideas during the meeting.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 確保在會議上記下你的想法。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To change something drastically, to disturb or upset.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 大幅改變某物，打擾或惹惱

examples.sentence: The new manager plans to [shake up] the department.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 新經理計劃大幅改變部門。

examples.sentence: Their decision might [shake up] the company’s structure.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他們的決定可能會打擾公司的結構。

examples.sentence: This news could [shake up] the community.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這條消息可能會影響社區。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To improve or get better, especially in behavior or performance.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 改善或變得更好，特別是在行為或表現上

examples.sentence: He needs to [shape up] if he wants to keep his job.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果他想保住工作，就必須改善。

examples.sentence: The team [shaped up] after the coach's advice.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在教練的建議下，球隊表現改善了。

examples.sentence: It's time to [shape up] your attitude toward work.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 是時候改善你對工作的態度了。

meanings.meaning_en_US: To increase rapidly or suddenly.

examples.sentence: Prices have [shot up] due to demand.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 由於需求，價格已經迅速上漲。

examples.sentence: The population of the city [shot up] in the last decade.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在過去十年中，這座城市的人口急劇增加。

examples.sentence: His anxiety levels have [shot up] lately.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 最近他的焦慮程度迅速上升。
